summary.p: 6 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 4; Qurʾānic Text: Q 84:15-101:8; 20 lines per page; Dimensions: 380 x 375mm; Script style: kūfī D.IV.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
6 fol. 375×380 mm (1.013). Support: parchment, thin, rigid, transparent, yellowish on the hair side and white on the flesh side. Writing material: black to dark brown ink.
Collation: one quire, probably incomplete, consisting of three bifolia.
I H1F H2F H3F / F4H F5H F6H.

Text layout: 285×270 mm (1.0555/1.0666), 20 lines. Ruling: absent for the most part but on the inner margin of fol. 3r there is a vertical line drawn with a hard-point tool far from the text area border; there traces of vertical hard point ruling of f. 4v as well. Script: D IV. Diacritics: absent. Vocalization: red round dots, placed irregularly; parts of the text have no vocalization, e.g. half of Surah 85 (fol. 1r), part of Surah 101 (fol. 6v).

Verse markers: individual verses – diagonal dashes (type 1.1.1) in the same ink as the main text; groups of 5 verses – a “shoe-shaped” letter alif in light-brown ink; groups of 10 verses – a round rosette with petals and a dot in the center, in light-brown ink.
For surah titles space of one -two lines has been reserved.
Inscriptions: on the margins Roman numerals for surah numbers are written, in the text on f. 1r verse numbers are marked with “Arabic” numerals.
Defects: traces of moisture on the margins; in some places the ink has slightly peeled off.
Old accession numbers: A. 3 (according to Langlois’ inventory)
Fol. 1r. Surah 84, verses 15(15) – 25(25)*. Incipit:[*بلى] إنّ ربّه كان به .
Fol. 6v. Surah 101, verses 1(1) – 6(8). Explicit: واما من خفّت [موازينه] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Arabe 336 (BNF); Gotha, 460."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
The fragments Arabe 336 (BNF) and Ms. orient. A 460 (Gotha) belong to the same manuscript.
